node.html: An application that helps people with low vision to understand their surrounding. This project is built to aid the Visually Impaired People so that they may easily understand, what’s happening around them. i-Sight takes a picture from the user’s camera and converts it into a descriptive text about the image, using this a visually struggling user can understand what is happening around him/her.

Developed a console-based Database Management System using only Python’s standard libraries. The application can serve multiple simultaneous users also, Implemented modules such as SQL Query Parser, Query Execution Engine, Transactions, SQL Dumps, ACID Properties, Logging, and ERD Generation. No libraries are used for any of the modules, each method is written from the scratch be it writing data to file or authentication user on startup, motivation behind this was to learn the workings of DBMS on as granular levels as possible.

Directly allows you to create a shortcut of any file on your device or URL to home screen. You can also customize appearance of the icon according to your liking. You can pick icon background color and write custom label which will be displayed in your home screen.

My profile on the command line! The Neelkanth Dabhi CLI (aka the most useless Node module ever published, in history, by anyone, ever).

Usage : $ npx @neelkanthjdabhi/cli

Pencil is an Android app, and it is simply the quickest way to offload ideas, thoughts, and to-dos without losing focus. Pencil helps you in reminding things by generating a persistent notification in your statusbar. The reminder doesn't pop-up or rings, it just sits in your notification tray and still does it's job most efficiently.
